com.dsi.ant.chip

Class AntChipState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dsi.ant.chip.AntChipState

  • public final class AntChipState
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains constants representing the various states an ANT chip can be in. For the most part a chip's state will follow the cycle of ...->DISABLED->ENABLING->ENABLED->DISABLING->DISABLED--...
    If the enabling process does not complete successfully the chip will transition back to a disabled state, indicating that the enable should be retried at a future time. The chip can transition to the HARD_RESETTING state from any other state at any time. It is implementation defined on whether a HARD_RESETTING state transitions to either an ENABLED or DISABLED state, but it must transition to one of those two states once the hard reset has been completed.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CHIPSTATE_DISABLED
      The chip is in a powered off state.
      static int CHIPSTATE_DISABLING
      The chip is in the process of transitioning to a disabled state.
      static int CHIPSTATE_ENABLED
      The chip is in a powered on state.
      static int CHIPSTATE_ENABLING
      The chip is in the process of transitioning to an enabled state.
      static int CHIPSTATE_ERROR
      The chip is in an unexpected error state.
      static int CHIPSTATE_HARD_RESETTING
      The chip is in the process of performing a hard reset.

    • Field Detail

      • CHIPSTATE_DISABLED

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_DISABLED
        The chip is in a powered off state. The chip is not capable of receiving serial messages while in this state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHIPSTATE_ENABLING

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_ENABLING
        The chip is in the process of transitioning to an enabled state. Note that if the process does not complete successfully the state will transition back to disabled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHIPSTATE_ENABLED

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_ENABLED
        The chip is in a powered on state. While in this state serial communication with the chip is possible.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHIPSTATE_DISABLING

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_DISABLING
        The chip is in the process of transitioning to a disabled state.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHIPSTATE_HARD_RESETTING

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_HARD_RESETTING
        The chip is in the process of performing a hard reset. This state can be transitioned to from any other state. While in this state the chip will not respond to TX, enable, or disable requests.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CHIPSTATE_ERROR

        public static final int CHIPSTATE_ERROR
        The chip is in an unexpected error state. This state can be transitioned to at any time. Which commands the hardware will respond to and how it will respond is hardware dependant.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
